org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store

Class EncryptionKeyTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseTestCase
          • org.apache.derbyTesting.junit.BaseJDBCTestCase
            • org.apache.derbyTesting.functionTests.tests.store.EncryptionKeyTest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    EncryptionKeyAESTest, EncryptionKeyBlowfishTest, EncryptionKeyDESTest

    public abstract class EncryptionKeyTest
extends BaseJDBCTestCase
    Tests various connection sequences to encrypted databases. Four kinds of external keys are used:
    1. the correct key
    2. an incorrect key
    3. a key with odd length (in hex representation)
    4. a key containing invalid characters

    The algorithms used for en-/decryption is determined by the subclasses, where a single algorithm and a set of keys are associated with each subclass.

    Databases are created in the EXTINOUT directory. Backups are made to EXTINOUT/backups and restored databases are put into EXTINOUT/restored if and only if the databases need to be both written and read. Otherwise backups are placed in EXTOUT. Testsuites generated from this class must be wrapped in a SupportFileSetup decorator.

        algorithm - encryption algorithm to use
        correctKey - the correct encryption key
        wrongKey - an incorrect encryption key

      • testInvalidRestoreFrom

        public void testInvalidRestoreFrom()
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Try to recover database with an invalid key.

        It should be noted that the existing database, which has been previously recovered from the same backup image, is deleted/overwritten even though Derby is unable to boot the backup image.

        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • obtainDbName

        java.lang.String obtainDbName(java.lang.String dbName,
                              java.lang.String subdirectory)
        Obtain absolute path for the specified database name.

        This absolute path is the name of the database (specified) prefixed with the absolute path to the EXTINOUT directory. The latter is determined by consulting SupportFilesSetup.

        Parameters:
        dbName - name of the database
        subdirectory - directory to prefix the database name with (can be null). Note that the database name will be prefixed with the path to the EXTINOUT directory even if this parameter is null.
        Returns:
        A string with the absolute path to the database.
        See Also:
        SupportFilesSetup

      • createBackupRestore

        private void createBackupRestore(java.lang.String sourceDb,
                                 java.lang.String targetDb)
                          throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create encrypted database, validate it, backup, restore and validate recovered database.

        The source db is shutdown, the recovered db is left booted.

        Parameters:
        sourceDb - the original database to create
        targetDb - the database to recover to
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

        Confirm that the specified encrypted database has not been booted.
        Parameters:
        dbName - name of an encrypted database
        Throws:
        junit.framework.AssertionFailedError - if the database has been booted (connection may or may not be established)

      • getConnection

        private java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String dbName,
                                          int keyMode)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Try to establish a connection to the named database with the specified type of key.
        Parameters:
        dbName - name of the database
        keyMode - what kind of key to use (correct, wrong, invalid, odd)
        Returns:
        A connection to the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if connection fails

      • getConnection

        private java.sql.Connection getConnection(java.lang.String dbName,
                                          int keyMode,
                                          java.lang.String recoveryAttribute)
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create a new connection to the specified database, using the given connection attributes.
        Parameters:
        dbName - name of the database
        keyMode - what kind of key to use (correct, wrong, invalid, odd)
        recoveryAttribute - attribute to recover a database from a backup, for instance createFrom or restoreFrom. Both the attribute and its value is expected.
        Returns:
        A connection to the database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if connection fails

      • createAndPopulateDB

        protected java.sql.Connection createAndPopulateDB(java.lang.String dbName)
                                           throws java.sql.SQLException
        Create a new database and populate it.

        The method fails with an exception if the database already exists. This is because it is the creation process that is to be tested.

        Parameters:
        dbName - name of the database to create
        Returns:
        A connection the to the newly created database.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database already exist, or a general error happens during database interaction

        Parameters:
        con - the database to validate the contents of
        Throws:
        junit.framework.AssertionFailedError - if there is a mismatch between the data in the database and the model
        java.sql.SQLException
